content.description:
South Face 5.8/A1 **** III-IV (7 pitches)

A classic line up the middle of the imposing South face. Originally done with some aid, possible to lead free.
content.protection: Wide range of nuts and cams (up to #3 Camalot)
content.location:
Middle of the South face.

Descend to the West by the walk up route

content.description:
SE Buttress 5.9 **** III (9-10 pitches)

A fine crack climb, following the ridge behind "The Monk" (semi-detatched feature on the lower right side of the South face). The 1st pitch crux (headwall) can be bypassed by using the crack on the left (5.8).
content.protection: A wide selection of nuts and cams (up to #3 Camalot). A single #2 and #3 works well. For the offwidth on P9, a single #4 and #5 will suffice.
content.location:
Begin to the left of The Monk and climb the ridge and buttress on right side of the South Face.

Descend by to the West by the walk-up route.

content.description:
NE Ridge 5.3 ** (7 pitches)

Follow the long broken ridge between "The Pope" (on the Canadian border) and Cathedral Peak. Each pitch has a move or two of (old school) 5.3 and some scrambling. 400' below the summit cross a dike (crux sections are on the next 2 short pitches).

A final airy (rope may be welcome) 4th class scramble leads to the summit. Descend down the regular "walk-up" route to the West (a short rappel may be desirable getting off the summit ridge).
content.protection: Light rack of nuts and several long slings.
content.location:
Scramble up the grassy SE slope from the main (Boundary) Trail to join the ridge.

Walk off to the West.

climbs.name: The Monk - West Cracks - Right Crack

content.description:
The Monk - West Cracks - Right Crack 5.7 ** (1-2 pitches)

Climbs the right crack on the left side of the South face. Crux is on the upper section.
content.location: On the left side of the South face.

climbs.name: The Monk - West Cracks - Left Crack

content.description:
The Monk - West Cracks - Left Crack 5.8 ** (1-2 pitch)

Climbs the left of the pair of cracks at the lower left side of The Monk's South Face. The crux is in the chimney near the top.
content.location: At the left side of the Monk.

content.description:
The Monk - Scarbo 5.9 ** (5 pitches)

Begin near the right side of the lowest part of the South face at a large ledge and zigzag up the right side of the face.
content.location:
On the right side of the South Face.

Descend via the NE gully (three 75' rappels)

content.description:
The Monk - Odine 5.8 ** (3 pitch)

Follows a prominent crack line left of center on The Monk's South Face. First two pitches are up a chimney, the final a jam crack.
content.location:
Vertical crack line on the left side of the South Face.

Descend via the NE gully (three 75' rappels)

content.description:
The Monk - Le Gibet 5.8 ** (5 pitches)

Climbs the middle of the South Face from the lowest point. The crux is passing left of the prominent roof at mid-face.
content.location:
Middle of the South Face.

Descend via the NE gully (three 75' rappels)
